page.title: Live at Ronnie Scott's (Fourth World album)

(1994) | This album = '''''Fourth World Live at Ronnie Scott's'''''
(1993) | Next album = ''[[Encounters of the Fourth World]]''
(1994) }} '''''Live at Ronnie Scott's''''' is a live album by the Brazilian jazz group [[Fourth World (band)|Fourth World]], that was released by the [[Ronnie Scott's|Ronnie Scott's Jazz House]] record label in 1992. The album was recorded live at [[Ronnie Scott's|Ronnie Scott's Jazz Club]] and features [[Airto Moreira]] and [[Flora Purim]] with Jose Neto, Gary Meek and Diana Moreira.[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r296501|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic: ''Fourth World''] accessed 07 June 2010 ==Track listing== {{tracklist | music_credits = yes | lyrics_credits = | title1 = Fourth World | music1 = Gary Meek, [[Airto Moreira]], Jose Neto | length1 = 7:34 | title2 = SÃ£o Felipe | music2 = Neto | length2 = 15:59 | title3 = Lua Flora | music3 = Neto, [[Flora Purim]] | length3 = 11:01 | title4 = Time One | music4 = Meek, Purim | length4 = 8:19 | title5 = Step Seven | music5 = Neto | lyrics5 = | length5 = 9:08 | title6 = Rainha da Noite | music6 = DeSouza, FiliÃ³, Filo | length6 = 6:57 | title7 = Sea Horse | music7 = Moreira, Neto | length7 = 14:24 | title8 = Africa | music8 = Moreira, Neto | length8 = 4:49 }} ==Personnel== *[[Airto Moreira]] - drums, percussion, vocals *[[Flora Purim]] - vocals, percussion, vocal effects *Jose Neto - electric nylon string guitar with polysubbass, vocals *Gary Meek - tenor, alto and soprano saxophones, flute, synthesizers, vocoder *Diana Moreira - backing vocals (tracks 3,4 & 8) ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Flora Purim albums]] [[Category:Airto Moreira albums]] [[Category:Albums recorded at Ronnie Scott's Jazz Club]]
